means.word_mean: 确信的;自信的;有信心的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French confident(e), from Italian confidente, from Latin confident- 'having full trust', from the verb confidere, from con- (expressing intensive force) + fidere 'trust'

entry.def: If you are confident about something, you are certain that it will happen in the way you want it to.

example.ex: I am confident that everything will come out right in time...
example.tran: 我坚信一切终究都会好起来。

example.ex: Mr Ryan is confident of success...
example.tran: 瑞安先生坚信一定会成功。

entry.def: If a person or their manner is confident, they feel sure about their own abilities, qualities, or ideas.

example.ex: In time he became more confident and relaxed...
example.tran: 过了一段时间，他变得更加自信、更为放松。

example.ex: She is a confident woman who is certain of her views.
example.tran: 她是一位充满自信的女性，对自己的观点深信不疑。

entry.def: If you are confident that something is true, you are sure that it is true. A confident statement is one that the speaker is sure is true.

example.ex: She is confident that everybody is on her side...
example.tran: 她确信所有人都站在她这边。

example.ex: 'Bet you I can', comes the confident reply.
example.tran: “我肯定行。”传来一个很有把握的回答。

means.word_mean: 1. having or marked by confidence or assurance;

sentences.sentence: "his manner is more confident these days"
"were convinced that it would be to their advantage to join"

means.word_mean: 3. not liable to error in judgment or action;

sentences.sentence: "most surefooted of the statesmen who dealt with the depression"- Walter Lippman
"demonstrates a surefooted storytelling talent"- Michiko Kakutani

auth_sentence.res_content: On Radio Four I am confident we are not.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On Radio Four I am confident we are not.

Sentence.sentence: But in recent years the capital's culinary (烹饪的) scene has developed to the point that it is now confident of its ability to please the tastes of any international visitor.
According to the author, a cheater who doesn't get caught right away will become more confident.

Nonetheless, the developers of the Chinatown garage are confident with the technology and are counting on it to squeeze 67 cars in an apartment-building basement that would otherwise fit only 24, accomplished by removing a maneuver space normally required.
If someone has a great sense of humor, were a son, it means that they are happy, socially confident and have a healthy perspective on life.

means.word_mean: 确信的, 肯定的，有把握的

sentences.en: I feel confident that we will win.
We need a confident leader to overcome these difficulties.
sentences.cn: 我们需要一个有信心的领导者来克服这些困难。

jushi.chinese: 他注意到她充满自信的微笑。

jushi.english: We need a confident leader to overcome these difficulties.
jushi.chinese: 我们需要一个有信心的领导者来克服这些困难。

jushi.english: He is confident in his ability to achieve success.
jushi.chinese: 他坚信自己有能力取得成功。
